page.title: 01Grendon Underwood Parish.
page.content: The area is a rural one consisting of farm land,which is predominately grassland,and part of the village of Grendon Underwood.There are three small areas of deciduous woodland and the River Ray runs through part of the farmland. The farms are of moderate size and although there are four lining the Village Street most are in the centre of the land they cultivate. The Village consists of one main street and an estate of houses used by the Prison Officers who work at the two prisons adjacent. Architectural styles range from Tudor cruck' houses to modern four bedroom detached. The A41,Akeman Street,crosses the S.W. part of the area where there is a hamlet known as Kingswood.
